content: These are the words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests from the town of Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
The  first gave messages to Jeremiah during the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.

The ’s messages continued throughout the reign of King Jehoiakim, Josiah’s son, until the eleventh year of the reign of King Zedekiah, another of Josiah’s sons. In August of that eleventh year the people of Jerusalem were taken away as captives.
“O Sovereign ,” I said, “I can’t speak for you! I’m too young!”
The  replied, “Don’t say, ‘I’m too young,’ for you must go wherever I send you and say whatever I tell you.
And don’t be afraid of the people, for I will be with you and will protect you. I, the , have spoken!”

Then the  said to me, “Look, Jeremiah! What do you see?”And I replied, “I see a branch from an almond tree.”
And the  said, “That’s right, and it means that I am watching, and I will certainly carry out all my plans.”
Then the  spoke to me again and asked, “What do you see now?”And I replied, “I see a pot of boiling water, spilling from the north.”
“Yes,” the  said, “for terror from the north will boil out on the people of this land.
Listen! I am calling the armies of the kingdoms of the north to come to Jerusalem. I, the , have spoken!
